key_channel_insights.line_content: Condor maintains 89.7% website-to-OTA parity, but OTA premiums are creeping up—now 6.5% of itineraries, led by long-haul and close-in travel.
90% of itineraries price lower on metasearch, yet the average discount is just –0.06%; parity is improving (+3 ppts WoW) with negligible offer gaps.
GDS prices run higher on 88.5% of itineraries and 10.3% of web fares are missing, with long-haul suffering the widest content deficit (28.2%).

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Website-to-OTA parity held on 89.7% of observed itineraries last week, remaining the dominant fare position.
OTA-higher cases increased to 6.5% (+0.6 pt WoW), especially on long-haul and close-in bookings.
Itineraries not found on OTAs doubled to 2.1%, signalling a widening distribution gap.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Absence rose 0.7 pt WoW; half of missing routes are long-haul.
Coverage slipped 0.9 pt WoW but still secures nine in ten itineraries.
Highest in a month; average premium modest at 0.18% but frequency rising.
Discount cases declined, concentrated in non-DE POS and close-in travel.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Parity 91.3%; OTA premiums limited to 5.9% with 0.21% mark-up.
Parity drops to 76.9%; OTA premiums 11.5% (+1.4 pt) and 10.3% content gaps.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Parity 90.9%; OTA premiums peak at 7.7%, up 0.8 pt WoW.
Parity 88.6%; OTA discounts triple those in DE (3.1% vs 0.3%).

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Parity 87.7%; OTA premiums 7.9% (+1.0 pt) and gaps 2.4%.
Parity 94.8%; premiums only 2.8% with low 1.4% gaps.

mse_highlights.line_content: MSE undercuts the website on 90% of itineraries, though average discount remains minimal at –0.06%.
Exact-price matches rose to 9.4% (+3 ppts WoW), indicating corrective progress.
Offer missing just 0.26% of the time, further declining week-over-week.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Down 12 bps WoW; operational impact negligible.
Best rate this quarter, up 3.1 ppts WoW.
Undersell share fell 3 ppts WoW; discount modest at –0.06%.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 89.7% lower on MSE (–0.05%); parity improving +3.3 ppts WoW.
97.4% lower with deeper –0.17% gap; small uptick WoW.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 88.4% lower (–0.07%); undersell share down 3.2 ppts WoW.

gds_highlights.line_content: 88.5% of itineraries are higher in GDS with an average 0.39% mark-up.
10.3% of web fares not found in GDS; issue edged up 0.2 pt WoW.
GDS undercuts remain rare (1.1%) but grew 54% WoW, needing review.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Up slightly WoW; distribution reach is most constrained in GDS.
Essentially non-existent; no material change WoW or MoM.
Incidence dipped 0.6 pt WoW; premium steady at ~0.4%.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: 91.1% dearer in GDS with 0.40% premium; gaps at 8.1%.
Higher pricing drops to 66.7% but gaps surge to 28.2%.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 93.6% higher with 0.31% premium; gaps limited to 5.3%.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 92.0% higher, smaller 0.29% premium; gaps improve to 6.1%.
